title: Counting Divisors (cube)
text: Let $\sigma_0(n)$ be the number of positive divisors of $n$.For example, $\sigma_0(1) = 1$, $\sigma_0(2) = 2$ and $\sigma_0(6) = 4$.Let $$S_3(n) = \sum _{i=1}^n \sigma_0(i^3).$$Given $N$, find $S_3(N)$.InputFirst line contains $T$ ($1 \le T \le 10000$), the number of test cases.Each of the next $T$ lines contains a single integer $N$. ($1 \le N \le 10^{11}$)OutputFor each number $N$, output a single line containing $S_3(N)$.ExampleInput512310100Output159732302Explanation for Input- $S_3(3) = \sigma_0(1^3) + \sigma_0(2^3) + \sigma_0(3^3) = 1 + 4 + 4 = 9$InformationThere are 5 Input files.- Input #1: $1 \le N \le 10000$, TL = 1s.- Input #2: $1 \le T \le 300,\ 1 \le N \le 10^{8}$, TL = 20s.- Input #3: $1 \le T \le 75,\ 1 \le N \le 10^{9}$, TL = 20s.- Input #4: $1 \le T \le 15,\ 1 \le N \le 10^{10}$, TL = 20s.- Input #5: $1 \le T \le 2,\ 1 \le N \le 10^{11}$, TL = 20s.My C++ solution runs in 7.1 sec. (total time)Source Limit is 12 KB.
